meanings.definition: The quality or state of being gray.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the subtle graynesses of the sky in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with various shades of graynesses, creating a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The graynesses of the cat's fur made it blend perfectly with the sofa.
meanings.sent4: In the early morning mist, the graynesses of the landscape seemed almost mystical.
meanings.sent5: She loved the soft graynesses of the winter sky, finding them peaceful and soothing.

meanings.definition: The dullness or lack of brightness in color.
meanings.sent1: The old photograph had lost its vibrancy, showing only graynesses of the past.
meanings.sent2: The rainy day added a layer of graynesses to the city streets.
meanings.sent3: Despite the graynesses of the room, she managed to create a cozy and inviting space.
meanings.sent4: The graynesses of the concrete walls gave the building a somber appearance.
meanings.sent5: The artist intentionally used graynesses to convey a sense of melancholy in the painting.

meanings.definition: The condition of being intermediate between black and white.
meanings.sent1: The grayscale image displayed various graynesses, creating a striking visual effect.
meanings.sent2: The design of the logo incorporated different graynesses to symbolize balance.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur had unique graynesses that made it stand out from other pets.
meanings.sent4: The graynesses of the sky during dawn painted a beautiful transition from night to day.
meanings.sent5: His outfit consisted of different graynesses, giving him a sophisticated and modern look.
